title: Linked Open Data
segmentation: OK, so good afternoon and welcome to the linked open Data Panel here.
Yes TC my name is John Davis from BT I'm the panel chair Ann.
Just a few brief slides to introduce the pen.
Home.
So our panelists here.
They are listed and they will be introducing themselves very briefly shortly.
And we have a very distinguished set of panelists for you this afternoon.
So very quickly I'm sure most of you know what linked open data is about, but essentially today too much data is stuck inside data silos, making it hard to query and hard to interlink.
Linked open data is about making data more publicly available and supplying standard technology to more easily link that data.
And query that data.
So this is what I just said essentially.
This is a famous diagram.
This was as of July 2009, just showing some of the many data sources that are now part of the linked Open Data Cloud.
Does it sometimes refer?
Many large datasets are now exposed by various governments around the world and also other public and even commercial organisations.
I saw a statistic in March this year saying that there were approximately 16 billion triples now public.
Available and we have a standard query language called Sparkle for querying this vast cloud of open data.

So the vision is that we have down the bottom here multiple previously heterogeneous data sources by having linked data standards we can find we can easily combine and build new applications that combine this data in new ways.
The words of Tim Berners Lee.
He wants to let 1000 Flowers bloom on the data web, so that's Tim's vision.

So to be a little bit more specific about this particular panel, the main themes that I've asked the panelists to think of a little bit about what the commercial opportunities that may arise from linked open data could be reflecting the commercial emphasis of this conference, of course, and also, what are the barriers which may hinder these opportunities from actually being realized?
So those are a couple of the themes that I've asked the panel.
To think about.
The format will be.
We will have short presentations from each panelist stating their position on these aspects.
5 minutes maximum and they'll be one question from each parent to each panelist.
From the panel immediately after their presentation.
So get an immediate reaction to each person's opening statement.
Following these will then go into much more open discussion where also ask for questions or comments from the audience as well as discussion among the panelists.
